title: Horizontal and vertical components of velocity

content.question: A box of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is released from rest and accelerates down a ramp that is at an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the horizontal, as shown. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the box and the ramp is <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. As the box is sliding down the ramp, how are the magnitudes of the horizontal and vertical components of the box’s velocity changing, if at all?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
